meanings.definition: To give someone a particular job or task.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will assign homework to the students.
meanings.sent2: Please assign a new project to each team member.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the cat will assign the task of catching mice to the dog.
meanings.sent4: The captain decided to assign the duty of steering the ship to the new sailor.
meanings.sent5: In the game, players must assign roles to each team member strategically.

meanings.definition: To allocate something to a particular person or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The manager will assign the budget for the project.
meanings.sent2: It is important to assign resources efficiently.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally assign the wrong book to the wrong student.
meanings.sent4: The chef will assign the best ingredients to each dish on the menu.
meanings.sent5: The committee will assign tasks to each member based on their strengths.

meanings.definition: To transfer legal rights or responsibilities to someone else.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer will assign the contract to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: It is common to assign copyrights to a publishing company.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to assign his disappearing act to his assistant.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to assign the property rights to a new developer.
meanings.sent5: The author will assign the movie rights to a film production company.
